Statistical languages:
Python: https://betterprogramming.pub/the-22-most-used-python-packages-in-the-world-7020a904b2e (determines popularity by pull requests/downloads)

scala: https://index.scala-lang.org/search?sort=stars&topics=scala&q=*&page=1 (most popular based on stars)

R: https://www.r-pkg.org/downloaded (based on downloaded packages)

Julia: https://juliapackages.com/trending?sort=stars (sort by stars)

Stata/SAS not on csv?
Stata: https://www.stata.com/features/overview/whats-hot-ssc-archive/



Web, app, game programming:
Javascript: https://javascript.plainenglish.io/top-10-most-popular-javascript-libraries-to-use-in-2021-5da60f187992 (Oct, 2020: based on # of downloads, dependencies and github stars), https://bestofjs.org/projects (ommitted guides to js)

java: https://techbeacon.com/app-dev-testing/most-popular-java-tools-every-phase-development

typescript: https://libraries.io/search?keywords=typescript&languages=TypeScript&licenses=ISC&order=desc&sort=stars (sort by stars, ignored other languages)

php: https://medium.com/issuehunt/50-most-popular-php-projects-on-github-c8cf6a242eb9 (based on github stars, ignored ones that would either classify under other projects [wechat] or projects that had generic names [october])

dart: https://github.com/yissachar/awesome-dart

Kotlin: https://awesomeopensource.com/projects/kotlin-library

lua: https://github.com/LewisJEllis/awesome-lua
